condition.narrative: Schedule 2. Section I. A. COVID-19 Emergency Response Plan of Honduras. Without limiting any other provision of this Agreement, theRecipient shall: (a) ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with the Emergency Response Plan (“ERP”); and (b)maintain, at all times during the implementation of the Project, adequate public health emergency coordination and managementarrangements, all in a manner acceptable to the Association.

Schedule 2. Section I. B. Institutional Arrangements. The Recipient shall establish, operate and maintain throughout theimplementation of the Project, a Project Implementing Unit (“PIU”) within SESAL, with functions, responsibilities, resources andcomposition satisfactory to the Association, as set forth in the Project Operational Manual.

Schedule 2. Section I. C. 1. The Recipient, through SESAL shall prepare, adopt, and thereafter carry out the Project in accordancewith a manual (“Project Operational Manual”), in a manner satisfactory to the Association. containing, inter alia: (a) specificprovisions on detailed arrangements for the carrying out of the Project; (b) the composition and responsibilities of the PIU withSESAL ...

Schedule 2. Section I. C. 2. Project Operational Manual. Without limitation on Section I.C.1 above, in order to ensure adequateimplementation of Part 1.b (iv) and (v) of the Project, the Recipient, through SESAL, shall prepare and adopt, and include as partof the updated Project Operational Manual, a manual for COVID-19 Vaccine delivery and distribution (“Vaccine Delivery andDistribution Manual”), in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

Schedule 2. Section I. C. 3. Project Operational Manual. The Recipient, through SESAL, shall carry out the Project in accordancewith this Agreement, the Project Operational Manual, and the Vaccine Delivery and Distribution Manual.

Schedule 2. Section I. C. 4. Project Operational Manual. Except as the Association shall otherwise agree, the Recipient, shall notassign, amend, abrogate, or waive the provisions of the Project Operational Manual or the Vaccine Delivery and Distribution Manualwithout prior approval of the Association.

Schedule 2. Section I. D. 1. Use of Military and Security Actors. Without limitations to the provisions of Section E of thisSchedule and if, during Project implementation, the Recipient decides to use its military or security forces, the Recipient,through SESAL, shall: (a) prior to any involvement of its military and/or security forces in the carrying out of Projectactivities, send a written notice to the Association (in accordance with Section 11.01(b) of the General Conditions) communicatingsuch decision, including the name of the military or security unit; (b) ensure that all activities carried out by said military orsecurity unit under the Project are under the control of SESAL and are undertaken exclusively for the purposes related to theProject; and (c) ensure that all goods, services, Operating Costs, and training financed by the Credit proceeds that may be used bysaid military or security unit are under the direction and control of SESAL and are carried out strictly in accordance with theProject Operational Manual and other arrangements or protocols that the Association may require for carrying out these activities.

Schedule 2. Section I. D. 2. Use of Military and Security Actors. Except as the Association may otherwise agree, the Recipientshall ensure that the ownership of any assets generated, goods procured, and works constructed by the military or security unitreferred to in paragraph 1 of Section I. D out of the Credit proceeds shall be transferred to, or shall vest, with SESAL or anyequivalent or appropriate line ministry or agency agreed with the Association.

Schedule 2. Section I. E. 1. Environmental and Social Standards. The Recipient, through SESAL, shall ensure, that the Project iscarried out in accordance with the Environmental and Social Standards, in a manner acceptable to the Association.

Schedule 2. Section I. E. 2. Environmental and Social Standards. Without limitation upon paragraph 1 above, the Recipient, throughSESAL, shall ensure that the Project is implemented in accordance with the Environmental and Social Commitment Plan (“ESCP”), in amanner acceptable to the Association. To this end, the Recipient shall ensure that: (a) the measures and actions specified in theESCP ...

Schedule 2. Section I. E. 4. Environmental and Social Standards. The Recipient shall, and shall cause SESAL to, ensure that thefollowing measures are taken in case its military or security forces (“security personnel”) are used in the implementation ofProject activities, and/or for provision of security to Project workers, sites and/or assets, in a manner satisfactory to theAssociation: (a) Adopt and enforce standards, protocols and codes of conduct for the selection and use of security or militarypersonnel, and screen such personnel to verify that they have not engaged in past unlawful or abusive behavior, including sexualexploitation and abuse (“SEA”), sexual harassment (“SH”) or excessive use of force; (b) ensure that such personnel is deployed inaccordance with the relevant requirements of ESSs and the ESCP; (c) ensure that such personnel is adequately instructed andtrained, prior to deployment and on a regular basis, on the use of force and appropriate conduct (including in relation tocivilian-military engagement, SEA and SH, and other relevant areas), as set out in the, ESMF and the ESCP; (d) ensure that thestakeholder engagement activities under the Stakeholder Engagement Plan include a communication strategy on the involvement of suchpersonnel under the Project; (e) ensure that any concerns or grievances regarding the conduct of such personnel are received,monitored, documented (taking into account the need to protect confidentiality), resolved through the Project’s grievancemechanism; and reported to the Association no later than 5 days after being received.

Schedule 2. Section I. E. 5. Environmental and Social Standards. The Recipient, through SESAL, shall ensure that: (a) all measuresnecessary are taken to collect, compile, and furnish to the Association through regular reports, with the frequency specified intheESCP, and promptly in a separate report or reports, if so requested by the Association, information on the status of compliancewith ...

Schedule 2. Section I. E. 5. Environmental and Social Standards. The Recipient, through SESAL, shall ensure that: (b) theAssociation is promptly notified of any incident or accident related to or having an impact on the Project which has, or is likelyto have, a significant adverse effect on the environment, the affected communities, the public or workers, in accordance with theESCP, ...

Schedule 2. Section I. E. 6. Environmental and Social Standards. The Recipient, through SESAL, shall establish, publicize, maintainand operate an accessible grievance mechanism, to receive and facilitate resolution of concerns and grievances of Project-affectedpeople, and take all measures necessary and appropriate to resolve, or facilitate the resolution of, such concerns and grievances,...

title.narrative: Designated laboratories with COVID-19 diagnostic equipment, test kits, and reagents
ICU beds in prioritized ICU units that are fully equipped and operational
Share of regional health authorities reports on corrective measures taken based on feedback from users of health facilities offering COVID-19 vaccination services published on SESAL's website
Share of vaccination leadership roles created by project financing filled by women
Percentage of population vaccinated, which is included in the priority population targets, as defined in the National Plan for the Introduction of the Vaccine against COVID-19
Percentage of female population vaccinated, which is included in the priority population targets, as defined in the National Plan for the Introduction of the Vaccine against COVID-19
Health management and information system to deploy the COVID-19 vaccine is in place, including functionality for identification, registration, and follow-up with COVID-19 vaccine recipients
Share of prioritized health facilities receiving the volume of PPEs planned under the project
